data.test_name: Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry Test - 4

1.q_string: \(0.5 \mathrm{~g}\) sample of containing \(\mathrm{MnO}_{2}\) is treated with \(\mathrm{HCl}\). The liberated \(\mathrm{Cl}_{2}\) is passed into KI solution, where \(\mathrm{I}_{2}\) is liberated. Now liberated \(\mathrm{I}_{2}\) requires \(30 \mathrm{~mL}\) of \(\frac{\mathrm{M}}{10} \mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{~S}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}\) for complete reaction. Then what is the percentage purity of \(\mathrm{MnO}_{2}\) in the sample?

For a given mixture of \(\mathrm{NaHCO}_{3}\) and \(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{CO}_{3}\), volume of a given \(\mathrm{HCl}\) required is \(x \mathrm{~ml}\) with phenolphthalein indicator and further \(\mathrm{y} \mathrm{~ml}\) required with methyl orange indicator. Then volume of \(\mathrm{HCl}\) for complete reaction of original \(\mathrm{NaHCO}_{3}\) is:

A bottle, which contains \(200 \mathrm{~ml}\) of \(0.1 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{~KOH}\), absorbs 1 millimole of \(\mathrm{CO}_{2}\) from the air. If the solution is then treated with standard acid using phenolphthalein indicator, the normality will be:

q_option: Both Assertion and Reason are correct and Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion.
Assertion is correct but Reason is incorrect
Reason is correct but Assertion is incorrect.
Both Assertion and Reason are correct but Reason is not the correct explanation for Assertion.
1.q_string:
Assertion (A): The empirical mass of ethane is half of its molecular mass.

Reason (R): The empirical formula represents the simplest whole number ratio of various atoms present in a compound.

A mixed solution of potassium hydroxide and sodium carbonate required \(15 \mathrm{~mL}\) of a \(\frac{\mathrm N}{20}\) \(\mathrm{HCl}\) solution when titrated with phenolphthalein as an indicator. But the same amount of the solution when titrated with methyl orange as an indicator required \(25 \mathrm{~mL}\) of the same acid. What is the amount of \(\mathrm{KOH}\) present in the solution?
Empirical formula of a compound is \(\mathrm{CH}_{2} \mathrm{O}\). If its molecular weight is \(180\) , then the molecular formula of the compound is:

\(25 \mathrm{~ml}\) of a solution containing \(\mathrm{HCl}\) and \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\) required 10 \(\mathrm{ml}\) of a \(1 \mathrm{~N} \mathrm{~NaOH}\) solution for neutralization. \(20 \mathrm{ml}\) of the same acid mixture on being treated with an excess of \(\mathrm{AgNO}_{3}\) gives \(0.1435 \mathrm{~g}\) of \(\mathrm{AgCl}\). The normality of the \(\mathrm{HCl}\) and the normality of the \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\) are respectively:

q_option: \(100 \mathrm{~g}\) of water is heated to give steam
A sample of \(\mathrm{N}_{2}\) gas is heated at constant pressure without any change in mass
\(36 \mathrm{~g}\) of carbon combines with \(32 \mathrm{~g}\) of oxygen to form \(68 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{of} \mathrm{CO}_{2}\)
\(10 \mathrm{~g}\) of carbon is heated in vacuum without any change in mass
1.q_string: Which of the following best explains the law of conservation of mass?

Potassium combines with two isotopes of chlorine ( \({ }^{(35} \mathrm{Cl}\) and \(\left.{ }^{37} \mathrm{Cl}\right)\) respectively to form two samples of \(\mathrm{KCl}\). Their formation follows the law of:

q_option: The mass of all the gases is the same
The number of moles of all the gases is the same but the temperature is different
The temperature, pressure and mass of all the flasks are the same
The temperature and pressure of all the flasks are the same
1.q_string: Three flasks of equal volumes contain \(\mathrm{CH}_{4}, \mathrm{CO}_{2}\) and \(\mathrm{Cl}_{2}\) gases respectively. They will contain equal number of molecules if:
\(6 \times 10^{20}\) molecules of \(\mathrm{CO}_{2}\) are removed from 220 milligram of \(\mathrm{CO}_{2}\). What are the remaining moles of \(\mathrm{CO}_{2}\)?
A compound was analyzed and found to be \(12.196 \mathrm{~C}, 71.796 \mathrm{~Cl}\), and \(16.296 \mathrm{~O}\). What is the empirical formula for this compound?
Calculate the numbers of \(\mathrm{Cl}^{-}\)and \(\mathrm{Ca}^{2+}\) ions in \(222 \mathrm{~g}\) of anhydrous \(\mathrm{CaCl}_{2}\).

\(8.7 \mathrm{gm}\) of pure \(\mathrm{MnO}_{2}\) is heated with an excess of \(\mathrm{HCl}\) and the gas evolved is passed into a solution of \(\mathrm{KI}\). The amount of \(\mathrm{I}_{2}\) liberated is:

q_option: Be a function of the molecular mass of the substance
1.q_string: If we consider that \(\frac{1}{6}\), in place of \(\frac{1}{12}\), mass of carbon atom is taken to be the relative atomic mass unit, the mass of one mole of a substance will:
When equal masses of methane and sulphur dioxide are taken, then the ratio of their molecules is:

A mixture of ethane and ethene occupies \(41 \mathrm{~L}\) at \(1 \mathrm{~atm}\) and \(500 \mathrm{~k}\) the mixture reacts completely with \(\frac{10}{3}\) moles of \(\mathrm{O}_ 2\) to produced \(\mathrm{CO}_2\) and \(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\). The mole fraction of ethane and ethene in the mixture are:

\(25 \mathrm{ml}\) of a solution of barium hydroxide on the titration with a \(0.1\) molar solution of hydrochloric acid gave a titre value of \(35 \mathrm{ml}\). The molarity of barium hydroxide solution is:

How many grams of concentrated nitric acid solution should be used to prepare \(250\) \(\mathrm{mL}\) of \(2 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{HNO}_{3}\)? The concentrated acid is \(70 \%(\mathrm{w} / \mathrm{w}) \mathrm{HNO}_{3}\).
Calculate the weight of lime \((\mathrm{CaO})\) obtained by heating \(200 \mathrm{~kg}\) of \(95 \%\) pure lime stone \(\left(\mathrm{CaCO}_{3}\right)\).

Find the equivalent weight of \(\mathrm{HNO}_{3}\) in following reaction.

\(\mathrm{Cu}+8 \mathrm{HNO}_{3} \longrightarrow 3 \mathrm{Cu}\left(\mathrm{NO}_{3}\right)_{2}+2 \mathrm{NO}+4 \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{O}\)

A sample of \(1.0 \mathrm{~g}\) of solid \(\mathrm{Fe}_{2} \mathrm{O}_{3}\) of \(80 \%\) purity is dissolved in a moderately concentrated \(\mathrm{HCl}\) solution which is reduced by zinc dust. The resulting solution required \(16.7 \mathrm{ml}\) of a \(0.1 \mathrm{M}\) solution of the oxidant. Calculate the number of electrons taken up by the oxidant (The atomic weights of \(\mathrm{Fe}\) and \(\mathrm{O}\) are 56 and 16 respectively)

\(3 \mathrm{~mol}\) of a mixture of \(\mathrm{FeSO}_{4}\) and \(\mathrm{Fe}_{2}\left(\mathrm{SO}_{4}\right)_{3}\) required \(100 \mathrm{ml}\) of \(2 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{KMnO}_{4}\) solution in acidic medium. Hence the mole fraction of \(\mathrm{FeSO}_{4}\) in the mixture is:

The equivalent weight of an element is \(15\). It forms an acidic oxide; with potassium hydroxide it forms a salt isomorphous with \(\mathrm{K}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\). The atomic weight of the element would be:

Moles of KI reacted \(=\frac{16.6}{166}=0.1\)

Equivalents of KI reacted \(=0.1[\because \mathrm{n}\)-factor of \(\mathrm{KI}=1]\)

\(\therefore\) Equivalents of \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{~S}\) formed \(=0.1\)

Moles of \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{~S}\) formed \(=\frac{0.1}{8}\left[\because \mathrm{n}\right.\)-factor of \(\left.\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{~S}=8\right]\)

Volume of \(\mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{~S}\) at \(1.0 \mathrm{~atm}\) and \(0^{\circ} \mathrm{C}=\frac{0.1}{8} \times 22400 \mathrm{ml}=\mathrm{2 8 0}\mathrm{~ml}\).

\(28 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{~N}_{2}\) and \(6 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{H}_{2}\) were mixed. At equilibrium \(17 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{NH}_{3}\) was formed. The weight of \(\mathrm{N}_{2}\) and \(\mathrm{H}_{2}\) at equilibrium are respectively:

q_option: Weight of the solvent in \(100 \mathrm{ml}\) solution is \(87 \mathrm{~g}\).
Weight of the solution in \(100 \mathrm{ml}\) of solution is \(100 \mathrm{~g}\).
1.q_string: If \(25\%(\mathrm{w} / \mathrm{v})\) of solution has a density of \(1.12 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{ml}^{-1}\), then:
\(46\mathrm{gm}\) of nitrogen dioxide at STP has:

A solution is containing \(2.52 \mathrm{~g} \mathrm{litre}^{-1}\) of a reductant. \(25 \mathrm{ml}\) of this solution required \(20 \mathrm{ml}\) of \(0.01 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{~KMnO}_{4}\) in acid medium for oxidation. Find the molecular weight of reductant. Given that each of the two atoms which undergo oxidation per molecule of reductant, show an increase in oxidation state by:

\(1 \mathrm{gm}\) of impure \(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{CO}_{3}\) is dissolved in water and solution made up to \(250 \mathrm{ml}\). To \(50 \mathrm{ml}\) of this solution, \(50 \mathrm{ml}\) of \(0.1 \mathrm{~N}\) \(\mathrm{HCl}\) is added and mixture after shaking well, required \(10 \mathrm{ml}\) of \(0.16 \mathrm{~N} \mathrm{NaOH}\) solution for complete neutralization. Calculate \(\%\) purity of sample of \(\mathrm{Na}_{2} \mathrm{CO}_{3}\).

1.1: Direction: In the following questions a statement of Assertion (A) followed by a statement of Reason (R) is given. Choose the correct option out of the choices given below each question.
